# [COMMUNITY NAME] Parking Rules and Regulations

**Effective Date:** [DATE]
**Last Updated:** [DATE]

---

## Overview

This document outlines the parking policies for [COMMUNITY NAME] to ensure safety, accessibility, and neighborhood aesthetics in accordance with the CC&Rs.

---

## Residential Parking

### Driveway and Garage
- Homeowners should primarily use their garage and driveway for parking
- Garages may not be converted to prevent vehicle parking
- Driveways must remain accessible for emergency vehicles

### Street Parking
- Vehicles may park on public streets in compliance with city ordinances
- No parking within [15 FEET] of fire hydrants
- No parking blocking mailboxes, driveways, or sidewalks
- [SPECIFIC STREET RESTRICTIONS IF ANY]

---

## Overnight Parking

- Vehicles may be parked on the street overnight for a maximum of [48/72 HOURS]
- Extended parking requires notification to management
- Guest vehicles must follow the same guidelines

---

## Prohibited Vehicles

The following vehicles may NOT be parked or stored on streets, driveways, or visible from the street:

| Vehicle Type | Street | Driveway | Garage Only |
|--------------|--------|----------|-------------|
| RVs/Motorhomes | No | No | Yes |
| Boats/Trailers | No | No | Yes |
| Commercial Vehicles (marked) | No | 24hr max | Yes |
| Utility Trailers | No | 72hr max | Yes |
| Inoperable Vehicles | No | No | No |
| Vehicles without current registration | No | No | No |

---

## Commercial Vehicles

- Vehicles with commercial markings/logos may not be parked visible from the street overnight
- Work vehicles must be parked in the garage
- Exceptions for temporary service calls (plumbers, contractors, etc.)

---

## Recreational Vehicles and Trailers

- RVs, boats, and trailers must be stored in enclosed garages
- Temporary loading/unloading: Maximum [24-48 HOURS]
- No storage on streets, driveways, or side yards
- [IF APPLICABLE: Community RV storage available at [LOCATION]]

---

## Guest Parking

- Guest parking is available in: [DESIGNATED AREAS]
- Guests should not block resident driveways
- Extended guest stays (over [72 HOURS]) require management notification

---

## Visitor Parking Permits

[IF APPLICABLE:]
- Temporary parking permits available from management
- Maximum [X] permits per household per month
- Display permit visibly on dashboard

---

## Handicap Parking

- Handicap-accessible spaces are located at: [LOCATIONS]
- Valid handicap placard/plate required
- Violators subject to city fines and towing

---

## Vehicle Maintenance

- Minor maintenance (oil changes, tire changes) permitted in driveways
- Major repairs must be completed within [48 HOURS]
- No vehicle repairs on streets or common areas
- Disposal of automotive fluids must comply with local regulations

---

## Towing Policy

Vehicles may be towed at owner's expense for:
- Blocking fire lanes or emergency access
- Parked in marked "No Parking" zones
- Inoperable vehicles remaining over [72 HOURS]
- Vehicles without current registration over [30 DAYS]
- Repeated violations after warning

**Towing Company:** [COMPANY NAME]
**Phone:** [PHONE NUMBER]

---

## Violation Process

| Offense | Action |
|---------|--------|
| First Violation | Written warning (24-hour notice to comply) |
| Second Violation | $[AMOUNT] fine |
| Third Violation | $[AMOUNT] fine + potential towing |
| Continued Violations | Towing at owner's expense |

---

## Fire Lane Requirements

- Fire lanes must remain clear at all times
- Red curbs indicate no parking zones
- Violators subject to immediate towing and city fines

---

## Speed Limits

- Community speed limit: [15-25 MPH]
- School zones (if applicable): [15 MPH]
- Near playgrounds and pools: [10 MPH]

---

## Contact Information

**Report parking violations:**
- Email: [COMMUNITY EMAIL]
- Phone: [PHONE NUMBER]
- Online Portal: [PORTAL URL]
